attributes.action: To reinstate dual line & electrify the Uckfield Line.
attributes.additional_details:
Safety & Resilience
•	The line is single-track in several long sections, creating bottlenecks and heightening risk.
Capacity & Service Frequency
o	Single-track sections currently limit services to one train per hour.
o	Government’s 2008 reinstatement study concluded that doubling the track would allow for up to 8 trains/hour in each direction. 
o	Electrification + double tracking would unlock greater frequency, flexible, reliable travel and alleviate chronic overcrowding and constraints.
attributes.background:
We the undersigned call on the UK Government and Dept for Transport to:
1.	Reinstate dual line along existing single-track stretches of the Uckfield line.
2.	Electrify the full route, returning it to third-rail network standards.
3.	Replace ageing diesel rolling stock with modern electric trains.
